name: Chamila Gamage
bio: Materba Kanatha Gamage Chamila Premanath Lakshitha (born January 4, 1979 in Unawatuna), or Chamila Gamage, is a former Sri Lankan cricketer, who played 2 Tests and 7 ODIs in early 2000s. He is a right-handed batsman and a right-arm fast-medium bowler.[1] He is a past student of Richmond College, Galle. He made his Twenty20 debut on 17 August 2004, for Sri Lanka Air Force Sports Club in the 2004 SLC Twenty20 Tournament.[2]
